name: py-pytools
description: A collection of tools for Python

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-decorator
dependencies.description:
The aim of the decorator module it to simplify the usage of decorators
for the average programmer, and to popularize decorators by showing
various non-trivial examples.

dependencies.name: py-appdirs
dependencies.description:
A small Python module for determining appropriate platform-specific
dirs, e.g. a "user data dir".

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-dataclasses
dependencies.description: A backport of the dataclasses module for Python 3.6

dependent_to.name: py-pyfr
dependent_to.description:
PyFR is an open-source Python based framework for solving advection-
diffusion type problems on streaming architectures using the Flux
Reconstruction approach of Huynh.

dependent_to.name: py-pycuda
dependent_to.description:
PyCUDA gives you easy, Pythonic access to Nvidia's CUDA parallel
computation API
